page.title: 12BISHOP BURTON FARM OPEN DAY
page.content: This annual event was first introduced in 1978 by the Principal of Bishop Burton College of Agriculture, Mr D. Hurst (who died in 1985), as a means of{"introducing the town to the {country"}while raising money for recreational facilities for college students. An average of Â£3500 has been raised each year which has contributed to the building of the College Sports Hall.There is a wide range of events organised to reflect all aspects of farming life - in the home and on the farm. All students and staff work together to provide livestock husbandry, machinery and horticultural displays, exhibitions of spinning, embroidery, dressmaking and cookery, organised children's sports, tractor rides. This year, sky diving was a popular feature.{Town and Country Day is very hard work but worth it!
